availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Ponsonby Furniss (New York County, New York, merchant, lawyer, notary public, and commissioner of deeds)

body.p: New York County, New York, merchant, lawyer, notary public, and commissioner of deeds. New Hampshire native. Son of Robert Furniss and Margaret Furniss. Married to Sophia Furniss. Father of William Furniss, Sophia Furniss, Gardner Furniss, Margaret Furniss, Robert Furniss, Hartman Furniss, Clementina Furniss, and Leon Furniss. Merchant in New York County, New York, in 1850. Employed Ann Brady, Ann Carr, Mary Carr, Catherine Conoly, Laura Cornish, Maria O'Connor, Margaret Feelan, Emeline Rogers, and Emma Kritzen in New York County in 1850. Employed Ann Fallen, Ann Carr, Lucy Smith, Joseph Wallie, Martha Scanlin, Frederick Heff, Frederick Flyther, John Rugler, Eliza Woods, and Adeba O'Connell as servants in New York County in 1855. Lawyer in New York County in 1861. Notary public in New York County in 1861. Commissioner of Deeds for the State of Kentucky in New York County in 1861.

ab.bibl:
